item.title: Connecting Zotero to AI Assistants via MCP
item.description: If you use Zotero for managing your research library, you might want to talk to your papers using an AI assistant. The Model Context Protocol (MCP) makes this possible — your AI can search, summarize, and analyze your local Zotero library without uploading anything to third-party servers. Or you can use semantic search with ZotSeek to resurface your hidden relevant paper and have better semantic search when the keyword isn’t in the title or abstract. I did indexing in the abstract mode only — 1 chunk per paper — 6k papers use 20MB disc space and took a bit less than 1 hour to index.

item.title: Streamline Your Research: Zotero's File Management Tricks
Zotero 7 is coming …
item.description:
Edit 1: Zotero 7 was realeased officialy in August 2024.

Zotero is a free, open-source reference management software. It make the process of collecting and storing references pretty easy (sometimes too easy !).

The latest stable, big release version, Zotero 6, was introduced in March 2022. It brought a new built-in PDF viewer and annotation system, as well as iOS and iPadOS apps.

Zotero 7 is Coming

Recently, the devs shared a public beta of Zotero 7. Most of the updates are related to transitioning from the legacy Firefox 60 ESR, which Zotero was originally built on top of (Zotero started as a browser extension), to the newer Firefox 102 ESR now and Firefox 115 ESR before the release this year.
